text: Nahid Islam (born in 1998) is a Bangladeshi student activist. He has been an ICT advisor to the interim government of Bangladesh since August 8, 2024. He was one of the main coordinators of the anti-discrimination student movement that led to the 2024 Bangladesh Quota Reform Movement, which later turned into a non-cooperation movement that overthrew the government of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. He is currently serving as Chief Advisor to Nobel Peace Prize winner Muhammad Yunus. == References == Category:Living people Category:1998 births Category:Bangladeshi Muslims
title: Nahid Islam
